items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message: Strong winds and spring tides may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast and on the Humber Estuary on Wednesday morning and evening. Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecast weather conditions. Areas most at risk include low lying coastal frontages, in particular around Kilnsea village. Flooding is possible between 08:00 and 11:45 AM, and 20:15-00:00 PM, Wednesday 28/09/2022. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 09:30 on 28/09/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: This alert is no longer in force, due to falling astronomical tide levels, and improving weather conditions.

items.description: The Essex coast from St Peters Flat to and including Shoeburyness and the Crouch and Roach estuaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Crouch, River Roach, North Sea

items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for reduced flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.
